channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Reparations Are a Drag on Reality
White House promotes Biden official who compared police to slave patrols, wants to abolish ICE
item.description: A Biden administration staffer with a controversial social media history was recently promoted into a job as associate communications director at the White House.

item.title: CNN Hits Rep. Allred for Border Crisis Flip-Flop
item.description: Rep. Colin Allred, D-Texas, who is running for Senate on a platform of getting tough on the southern border, once dismissed the crisis of illegal immigration as a "right-wing echo chamber," CNN reported Thursday.Notably, Allred is bringing his new tough outlook on the...

item.title: Two Tiers: Court Rejects Steve Bannon's Bid to Delay Prison Term, Must Report July 1 for 4-Month Sentence
Gay Trump voters shatter Dem 'lie' LGBT Americans only vote blue, says Log Cabin Republicans chief
item.description: Gay voters in the 2024 election are seeing through the Democratic Party's "pandering" as Trump delivers "authentic" messaging, says Log Cabin Republicans president Charles Moran.

item.title: Rep. Perry to Newsmax: Adversaries Act Due to Biden's Weakness, Trump's Return
item.description: Rep. Scott Perry, R-Pa., expressed concerns about President Joe Biden's leadership in a Thursday interview with Newsmax, highlighting what he sees as a critical vulnerability for the United States.

item.title: CBS Teases 'Surprises' From Joe Biden for the Debate
Bloomberg shells out millions to help Biden battle Trump in 2024 presidential election rematch
item.description: Mega-billionaire Michael Bloomberg made a massive contribution of $20 million to help boost Biden while conservative banking heir Timothy Mellon dished out $50 million to support Trump

item.title: FCC's Carr to Newsmax: Sound Alarm on Soros Radio Takeover Bid
item.description: Brendan Carr, one of two Republican members of the five-member FCC, warned Thursday on Newsmax about an effort by a foreign company founded by liberal billionaire George Soros that is seeking to fast-track the purchase of more than 200 radio stations in the U.S.

item.title: OUTRAGE: DA Bragg Drops Charges on Nearly All the Columbia Rioters Arrested
Trump classified docs judge to weigh alleged 'unlawful' appointment of Special Counsel Jack Smith
item.description: Judge Aileen Cannon, who is presiding over former President Trump's classified records case, is holding a hearing Friday to consider whether the appointment of special counsel Jack Smith was “unlawful."

item.title: Washington Post Columnist: Time for Biden to Tap Hillary Over Kamala
item.description: A Washington Post columnist has written that she thinks President Joe Biden would allay worries about his age -- he's 81-- if he dropped Vice President Kamala Harris from his ticket. Her replacement? The columnist says it ought to be Hillary Clinton.

item.title: Putin Threatens South Korea With Something They Won't Like If It Helps Ukraine
Missouri AG to sue New York over 'unconstitutional lawfare' against Trump: 'Time to restore the rule of law'
item.description: Missouri AG Andrew Bailey said he will sue New York over its "direct attack on our democratic process through unconstitutional lawfare against President Trump."

item.title: Lara Trump to Newsmax: Biden Has to Defend Record in Debate
item.description: Republican National Committee co-Chair Lara Trump told Newsmax on Thursday that it won't be enough for President Joe Biden to stand for 90 minutes and "hack it" against Donald Trump in next week's first presidential debate — he has to defend his "abysmal" record.
